title: Contributing to wbcmd
text: Thank considering contributing wbcmd!

title: Contributing to wbcmd
text: wbcmd aims wrap ~165 wb_command subcommands. Adding new wrapper follows consistent pattern: Create R/wb_<domain>_<operation>.R (e.g., R/wb_cifti_info.R) Use check_path() validate input files Use validate_outfile() prepare output paths Call wb_cmd() subcommand arguments Add tests tests/testthat/test-wb_<domain>_<operation>.R Run devtools::document() devtools::check()

title: Contributing to wbcmd
Contributing to wbcmd
text: Self-explanatory naming, comments (except workarounds) tidyverse style roxygen2 documentation

title: Contributing to wbcmd
text: One wrapper per PR fine Include tests (mocking CI wb_command available) Run devtools::check() errors warnings

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: Install Connectome Workbench, load package: wb_sitrep() checks whether binary reachable prints finds. macOS Linux, wbcmd searches common installation paths system PATH automatically. binary lives somewhere unusual, tell wbcmd : full lookup order : R option wbcmd.path Environment variable WB_PATH Platform-specific defaults (e.g. /Applications/wb_view.app/... macOS) System PATH Set WB_PATH .Renviron never think .

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: wb_cmd() universal entry point. takes subcommand name arguments exactly type command line: Every wrapper function wbcmd calls wb_cmd() internally. wrapper doesn’t exist command need, wb_cmd() always works.

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: wrappers handle argument construction, file validation, output path management. error command runs input file missing, create output directories fly.

title: Getting started with wbcmd
Getting started with wbcmd
Getting started with wbcmd
Getting started with wbcmd

what: Map a volume to a surface
title: Getting started with wbcmd
Getting started with wbcmd
text: cifti_math(), metric_math(), volume_math() take symbolic expression named list file paths:
code: cifti_math(   "(x + y) / 2",   cifti_out = "average.dscalar.nii",   var = list(     x = "subj01.dscalar.nii",     y = "subj02.dscalar.nii"   ) )

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: Every wrapper function includes “Connectome Workbench Help” section documentation, pulled directly wb_command build time. can also call wb_help() interactively:

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: ciftiTools reads writes CIFTI files R objects. wbcmd runs Workbench operations files. complement — ciftiTools gives data R, wbcmd gives processing pipeline. packages need binary. Point path share setup: typical workflow reads data ciftiTools, processes files wbcmd, reads results back: ciftiTools also run_wb_cmd() function takes pre-formatted command string. already use , wbcmd’s wb_cmd() job addition path detection, argument quoting, verbose logging.
code: wb_path <- "/opt/workbench/bin_linux64/wb_command"  wbcmd::set_wb_path(wb_path) ciftiTools::ciftiTools.setOption("wb_path", wb_path) library(ciftiTools) library(wbcmd)  xii <- read_cifti("data.dtseries.nii", brainstructures = "all")  cifti_parcellate(   "data.dtseries.nii",   "atlas.dlabel.nii",   direction = "COLUMN",   cifti_out = "parcellated.ptseries.nii" )  parcellated <- read_cifti("parcellated.ptseries.nii")

title: Getting started with wbcmd
text: default, wbcmd prints full command running . Turn cleaner output: set WB_VERBOSE=FALSE .Renviron.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mowinckel (2026). wbcmd: Wrapper Functions Connectome Workbench Commands. https://github.com/lcbc-uio/wbcmd.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wbcmd: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands},   author = {Athanasia Mo Mowinckel},   year = {2026},   url = {https://github.com/lcbc-uio/wbcmd}, }

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: R wrapper Connectome Workbench wb_command CLI (~165 neuroimaging subcommands). Architecture mirrors freesurfer2 package dispatcher pattern.

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
code: Command wrappers (cifti_*, surface_*, metric_*, volume_*, file_*)         │         ▼     wb_cmd()  ← central dispatcher, all wrappers call this         │         ├── validate_wb_env() → have_wb() → get_wb_path() → get_wb_setting()         ├── try_wb_cmd()      → system() call         └── check_wb_result() → validates exit status + output files

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: Lookup order: R option → environment variable → platform defaults → PATH macOS default: /Applications/wb_view.app/Contents/usr/bin/wb_command

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: Core infra keeps wb_ prefix: wb_cmd(), wb_sitrep(), wb_help(), wb_version(), have_wb(), get_wb_path(), set_wb_path() Command wrappers use wb_command domain prefix, wb_: cifti_parcellate(), surface_vertex_areas(), metric_math(), volume_math(), file_information() Function names map directly wb_command subcommands: cifti_reduce() → -cifti-reduce

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: Create R/<domain>_<operation>.R (e.g. R/cifti_erode.R) Pattern: Create tests/testthat/test-<domain>_<operation>.R : Mock tests: use capture_wb_cmd() verify command construction Integration tests: wrap skip_if_no_wb(), use create_test_sphere() fixtures Validation tests: verify errors missing files (class "wbcmd_error") Run devtools::document() devtools::check()
code: #' [Title matching wb_command description] #' #' Wraps `wb_command -<subcommand>` ... #' @export my_wrapper <- function(required_input, ..., verbose = get_wb_verbosity()) {   check_path(required_input, arg = "required_input")  # validate inputs   outfile <- validate_outfile(outfile, ext = ".ext")   # prepare outputs   args <- c(shQuote(required_input), ...)              # build args   wb_cmd("-subcommand", args, verbose = verbose)       # dispatch }

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: capture_wb_cmd() returns environment (list) $cmd updates reference.
code: # Mock test — verifies command string without running wb_command it("constructs correct command", {   captured <- capture_wb_cmd()   # ... call wrapper ...   expect_match(captured$cmd, "-subcommand")   expect_match(captured$cmd, "expected_arg") })  # Integration test — actually runs wb_command it("produces output", {   skip_if_no_wb()   sphere <- create_test_sphere()   # ... call wrapper with real files ...   expect_true(file.exists(output)) })

what: ciftiTools overlap — do NOT wrap these
title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: ciftiTools already covers ~19 wb_command subcommands. Avoid wrapping: -cifti-separate, -cifti-merge, -cifti-smoothing, -cifti-convert, -cifti-create-dense-timeseries, -cifti-create-dense-scalar, -cifti-create-label, -cifti-change-mapping, -cifti-resample, -surface-resample, -surface-create-sphere, -surface-flip-lr, -set-structure, -metric-resample, -label-resample, -metric-smoothing, -metric-merge, -nifti-information, -set-map-names, -volume-label-import

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: comments except workarounds upstream bugs Self-explanatory naming tidyverse style, roxygen2 docs describe()/() test structure Never use package:: package::: tests Always test expected messages/warnings/errors, never suppress Use cli user-facing messages via wb_abort(), wb_warn(), wb_inform() helpers pass .envir = rlang::caller_env() cli correct glue scoping

title: wbcmd — LLM Development Context
text: Runtime: cli, lifecycle, rlang, tools, utils Test: testthat (>= 3.0.0), withr System: Connectome Workbench (wb_command)

what: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands
title: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands
text: wbcmd provides R wrapper functions Connectome Workbench command-line tool (wb_command).

title: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands
text: can install wbcmd CRAN : install development version GitHub : also need Connectome Workbench installed system.

title: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands
text: wbcmd looks wb_command following order: R option wbcmd.path environment variable WB_PATH Platform-specific default installation paths system PATH Check setup : wb_command found automatically, set path explicitly:

title: Wrapper Functions for Connectome Workbench Commands
text: commands flow central wb_cmd() dispatcher: Convenience wrappers provide ergonomic interface: Get help subcommand:
code: wb_cmd("-version") wb_cmd("-cifti-info", c("data.dscalar.nii")) cifti_parcellate(   "data.dtseries.nii",   "atlas.dlabel.nii",   direction = "COLUMN",   cifti_out = "parcellated.ptseries.nii" )  cifti_correlation(   "data.dtseries.nii",   "corr.dconn.nii",   fisher_z = TRUE ) wb_help("-cifti-parcellate")

what: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
title: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
text: Validates outcome wb_command execution inspecting exit status whether expected output file produced.

title: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
code: check_wb_result(   res,   fe_before = NA,   fe_after = NA,   outfile = NULL,   cmd_name = NULL )

title: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
text: res return value system(). fe_before Logical; output file exist execution? fe_after Logical; output file exist execution? outfile Path expected output file. cmd_name command name, diagnostic messages.

title: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
text: res, invisibly.

title: Check the result of a workbench command — check_wb_result
code: check_wb_result(0L, fe_before = FALSE, fe_after = TRUE,                 outfile = "out.nii", cmd_name = "test")

Dilate a CIFTI file — cifti_dilate
text: Wraps wb_command -cifti-dilate fill zeros missing data values nearby brainordinates.

title: Dilate a CIFTI file — cifti_dilate
code: cifti_dilate(   cifti_in,   direction = c("COLUMN", "ROW"),   surface_distance,   volume_distance,   cifti_out,   left_surface = NULL,   right_surface = NULL,   nearest = FALSE,   verbose = get_wb_verbosity() )

title: Dilate a CIFTI file — cifti_dilate
text: cifti_in Path input CIFTI file. direction Direction dilate. One "COLUMN" "ROW". surface_distance Surface dilation distance mm. volume_distance Volume dilation distance mm. cifti_out Path output CIFTI file. left_surface Path left hemisphere surface. right_surface Path right hemisphere surface. nearest Logical; use nearest good value instead weighted average? verbose Logical; print command output?

what: Find clusters in a CIFTI file — cifti_find_clusters
title: Find clusters in a CIFTI file — cifti_find_clusters
text: Wraps wb_command -cifti-find-clusters threshold CIFTI file filter clusters surface area volume size.

title: Find clusters in a CIFTI file — cifti_find_clusters
code: cifti_find_clusters(   cifti_in,   surface_value_threshold,   surface_minimum_area,   volume_value_threshold,   volume_minimum_size,   direction = c("COLUMN", "ROW"),   cifti_out,   left_surface = NULL,   right_surface = NULL,   less_than = FALSE,   verbose = get_wb_verbosity() )

title: Find clusters in a CIFTI file — cifti_find_clusters
text: cifti_in Path input CIFTI file. surface_value_threshold Minimum value surface vertices. surface_minimum_area Minimum cluster surface area (mm^2). volume_value_threshold Minimum value volume voxels. volume_minimum_size Minimum cluster volume size (mm^3). direction Direction use. One "ROW" "COLUMN". cifti_out Path output CIFTI file. left_surface Path left hemisphere surface. right_surface Path right hemisphere surface. less_than Logical; find clusters threshold instead ? verbose Logical; print command output?

what: Evaluate expression on CIFTI files — cifti_math
title: Evaluate expression on CIFTI files — cifti_math
text: Wraps wb_command -cifti-math perform element-wise mathematical operations CIFTI files using expression language.

title: Evaluate expression on CIFTI files — cifti_math
code: cifti_math(   expression,   cifti_out,   var,   fixnan = FALSE,   override_mapping_check = FALSE,   verbose = get_wb_verbosity() )

title: Evaluate expression on CIFTI files — cifti_math
text: expression Math expression string (e.g. "(x - mean) / stdev"). cifti_out Path output CIFTI file. var Named list input CIFTI file paths. Names correspond variable names used expression. fixnan Logical; replace NaN results 0? override_mapping_check Logical; skip map count check? verbose Logical; print command output?

title: Evaluate expression on CIFTI files — cifti_math
text: result underlying wb_cmd() call.

title: Parcellate a CIFTI file — cifti_parcellate
text: Wraps wb_command -cifti-parcellate create parcellated data dense CIFTI file using label parcellation.

title: Parcellate a CIFTI file — cifti_parcellate
code: cifti_parcellate(   cifti_in,   cifti_label,   direction = c("COLUMN", "ROW"),   cifti_out,   spatial_weights = NULL,   method = NULL,   only_numeric = FALSE,   verbose = get_wb_verbosity() )

title: Parcellate a CIFTI file — cifti_parcellate
text: cifti_in Path input CIFTI file. cifti_label Path parcellation label file (.dlabel.nii). direction Direction parcellate along. One "COLUMN" "ROW". cifti_out Path output parcellated CIFTI file. spatial_weights Optional spatial weights specification. list one element: either left_area_surf right_area_surf paths, cifti_weights path. method Parcellation method. One "MEAN" (default), "MAX", "MIN", "INDEXMAX", "INDEXMIN", "MEDIAN", "MODE", "COUNT_NONZERO", "SUM", "STDEV", "SAMPSTDEV", "PERCENTILE". only_numeric Logical; exclude non-numeric values? verbose Logical; print command output?

what: Evaluate expression on metric files — metric_math
title: Evaluate expression on metric files — metric_math
text: Wraps wb_command -metric-math perform element-wise mathematical operations metric files surface vertex.

title: Evaluate expression on metric files — metric_math
code: metric_math(   expression,   metric_out,   var,   fixnan = FALSE,   verbose = get_wb_verbosity() )

title: Evaluate expression on metric files — metric_math
text: expression Math expression string (e.g. "(x - mean) / stdev"). metric_out Path output metric file. var Named list input metric file paths. Names correspond variable names used expression. fixnan Logical; replace NaN results 0? verbose Logical; print command output?

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ metric_math(   "abs(x - y)",   metric_out = "diff.func.gii",   var = list(x = "post.func.gii", y = "pre.func.gii") ) } # }

title: Compute spatial statistics on a metric file — metric_stats

title: Compute spatial statistics on a metric file — metric_stats
text: metric_in Path input metric file. operation Reduction operation. One "MAX", "MIN", "INDEXMAX", "INDEXMIN", "SUM", "PRODUCT", "MEAN", "STDEV", "SAMPSTDEV", "VARIANCE", "TSNR", "COV", "L2NORM", "MEDIAN", "MODE", "COUNT_NONZERO". percentile Numeric percentile compute (alternative operation). column Integer; compute single column (1-indexed). roi Path metric ROI file. show_map_name Logical; print map name result? verbose Logical; print command output?

title: Compute spatial statistics on a metric file — metric_stats
text: Character vector output lines (stats values).

title: Map volume data to a surface — volume_to_surface_mapping

One "trilinear", "enclosing", "cubic", "ribbon-constrained", "myelin-style". inner_surface Path inner surface (required "ribbon-constrained" "myelin-style"). outer_surface Path outer surface (required "ribbon-constrained" "myelin-style"). verbose Logical; print command output?

title: Execute a Connectome Workbench command — wb_cmd
text: cmd wb_command subcommand (e.g. "-cifti-separate"). args Character vector arguments pass cmd. ... Additional arguments, currently unused. verbose Logical; print command output? Defaults get_wb_verbosity(). intern Logical; capture output character vector? Defaults value verbose.

title: Execute a Connectome Workbench command — wb_cmd
text: intern = TRUE, character vector command output. Otherwise exit status (integer).

what: wbcmd: Wrapper Functions for 'Connectome Workbench' Commands — wbcmd-package
title: wbcmd: Wrapper Functions for 'Connectome Workbench' Commands — wbcmd-package
text: Provides R wrapper functions 'Connectome Workbench' command-line tool ('wb_command'). Includes central dispatcher executing workbench commands, environment detection, convenience wrappers common operations Connectivity Informatics Technology Initiative (CIFTI), Geometry Informatics Technology Initiative (GIFTI), surface files.

title: wbcmd: Wrapper Functions for 'Connectome Workbench' Commands — wbcmd-package
text: Maintainer: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel .m.mowinckel@psykologi.uio.(ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: wbcmd 0.1.0
text: Initial package scaffold core dispatcher architecture. Added wb_cmd() central dispatcher wb_command operations. Added environment detection: get_wb_path(), have_wb(), wb_version(), set_wb_path(). Added hierarchical settings lookup via get_wb_setting(). Added wb_sitrep() situation report diagnostics. Added wb_help() access wb_command help text. Added CIFTI wrappers: cifti_parcellate(), cifti_math(), cifti_correlation(), cifti_reduce(), cifti_average(), cifti_find_clusters(), cifti_stats(), cifti_weighted_stats(), cifti_dilate(), cifti_gradient(). Added surface wrappers: surface_generate_inflated(), surface_geodesic_distance(), surface_vertex_areas(), surface_curvature(), surface_distortion(), surface_information(). Added metric wrappers: metric_math(), metric_stats(). Added volume wrappers: volume_math(), volume_to_surface_mapping(). Added file_information() inspecting workbench file.
